meanings.definition: A prickly plant that grows in sandy areas.
meanings.sent1: I got a painful prick from the sandburrs while walking on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The sandburrs in the desert can be quite sharp and uncomfortable to step on.
meanings.sent3: The sandburrs seemed to be playing a game of 'catch me if you can' with the beachgoers.
meanings.sent4: The sandburrs in the garden were like tiny natural barbed wire fences.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the sandburrs lurking in the sand, ready to surprise your bare feet.

meanings.definition: The seed or fruit of a sandbur plant.
meanings.sent1: The sandburrs scattered across the ground were ready to sprout into new plants.
meanings.sent2: I collected some sandburrs to study their seeds under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid the sandburrs in the bird feeder as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The sandburrs were like tiny treasure chests waiting to release their seeds.
meanings.sent5: Each sandbur had a secret inside, a potential new plant waiting to grow.
